build_db module¶

class build_db.Build(commit_sha, logs, status)[source]¶

Bases: Model

Represents a build in the database.

__init__(commit_sha, logs, status)¶

Initialize a new Build object.

Parameters:

  • commit_sha (str) – Commit SHA for the build.

  • logs (str) – Build logs.

  • status (str) – Build status.

static add_build(commit_sha, logs, status)[source]¶

Add a new build to the database.

Parameters:

  • commit_sha (str) – Commit SHA for the build.

  • logs (str) – Build logs.

  • status (str) – Build status.

Example

>>> Build.add_build("abcdef123456", "Build logs...", "success")
Adding build to database.
build_date¶

Date and time of the build.

commit_sha¶

Commit SHA for the build (max length 100).

id¶

Primary key, auto-incrementing integer.

logs¶

Build logs (text).

metadata = MetaData()¶
query: t.ClassVar[Query]¶

A SQLAlchemy query for a model. Equivalent to db.session.query(Model). Can be customized per-model by overriding query_class.

Warning

The query interface is considered legacy in SQLAlchemy. Prefer using session.execute(select()) instead.

query_class¶

alias of Query

registry = <sqlalchemy.orm.decl_api.registry object>¶
status¶

Build status (max length 20).

build_db.init_db(app)[source]¶

Initialize the database for the Flask app.

Parameters:

app (Flask) – The Flask application instance.

Example

>>> from flask import Flask
>>> app = Flask(__name__)
>>> init_db(app)
